parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Headlight Failure and Electrical Fire Hazard
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden loss of headlights while driving can cause reduced visibility, increasing the risk of accidents, and the electrical fire hazard can lead to vehicle damage or even total loss.
symptoms: especially when using high beams for an extended period
headlights may work again after a short period of time.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the wiring harness can cause electrical fires, leading to vehicle damage or total loss, and potentially harm occupants.
symptoms: wiring harness failure in the dash.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of connectors can cause electrical fires, leading to vehicle damage or total loss, and potentially harm occupants.
Worn-out ball joints can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, and pose a significant safety risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: clunking or creaking noises from the front suspension
and random veering to the left or right.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A malfunctioning steering gearbox can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, and pose a significant safety risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: Random veering to the left or right
constant correcting required to stay in one lane
and feeling of unsafety while driving.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire tread separation can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, and pose a significant safety risk to the driver and passengers.
The failure of the serpentine drive belt can cause loss of power steering and eventual loss of power to operate the vehicle, leading to a dangerous situation, especially on wet roads.
symptoms: The serpentine drive belt slips off or shreds while driving on wet roads
causing loss of power steering and eventual loss of power to operate the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The random stalling of the engine can cause a loss of control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: often after operating for more than 45 minutes
and can only be restarted after a wait period of 20-30 minutes; engine code indicates a misfire.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the head gasket can cause engine damage, overheating, and loss of power, leading to a breakdown or accident.
The failure of the water pump seal can cause engine overheating, damage, and loss of power, leading to a breakdown or accident.
symptoms: The water pump seal fails due to pitting and corrosion of the aluminum housing

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission problems can cause loss of control, accidents, or injuries, especially during extended driving.
symptoms: The transmission "clunks" when downshifting between 2nd and 1st gear

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The electrical problems can cause unexpected and unpredictable behavior, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The electrical problems include unexpected windshield wiper activation
unexpected electric door lock and car alarm activation
and ignition failure during initial attempts to start the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Transmission Failure to Shift Out of First Gear
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transmission to shift out of first gear can cause the vehicle to stall or lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The transmission will not shift out of first gear
the vehicle idles rough and tries to die when in reverse
the transmission whines when in reverse.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Transmission failure can cause the vehicle to lose power, stall, or become stuck in gear, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: the transmission slips or hesitates while shifting.
